medical_history.chief_complaint: Allergic contact dermatitis from a natural deodorant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patients demonstrated various duration and intensity of symptoms related to exposures to the natural deodorant. One patient had a 1-year history of pruritic rash, while another experienced acute worsening of hand dermatitis after extended use. Several others reported dermatitis upon using the natural deodorant, with some symptoms persisting while others resolved upon avoidance.
medical_history.past_medical_history: One patient had positive patch test reactions to nickel and neomycin. Another had a history of atopic dermatitis since childhood and allergic rhinitis. Overall, relevant histories included recurrent hand dermatitis for over 30 years and dermatological reactions to various personal care products.
medical_history.family_history: One patient had a sister with atopic dermatitis, while another sibling died at six months possibly due to pneumonia. Other family histories were not detailed.
medical_history.social_history: One patient was a mill operator with prolonged occupational exposures to wood products. There were no specified histories regarding smoking, alcohol consumption, or other lifestyle factors.
